block.p: Cecily Jane Fluke and Mark Ryan Hall were married yesterday at the Central Park Zoo in Manhattan. The Rev. Owen Lafferty, a Catholic priest and a friend of the family, led the interfaith ceremony.

Mrs. Hall, 30, is an associate editor in the editorial statistics department at Forbes magazine in Manhattan. She graduated from the College of Wooster in Ohio. Her parents, Gretchen and James Fluke, live in Dublin, Ohio. Her father is a jazz musician based in Columbus. Her mother, who is retired, taught eighth grade social studies at Ridgeview Middle School, also in Columbus.
Cecily Jane Fluke and Mark Ryan Hall were married yesterday at the Central Park Zoo in Manhattan. The Rev. Owen Lafferty, a Catholic priest and a friend of the family, led the interfaith ceremony.

Mrs. Hall, 30, is an associate editor in the editorial statistics department at Forbes magazine in Manhattan. She graduated from the College of Wooster in Ohio. Her parents, Gretchen and James Fluke, live in Dublin, Ohio. Her father is a jazz musician based in Columbus. Her mother, who is retired, taught eighth grade social studies at Ridgeview Middle School, also in Columbus.

Mr. Hall, 34, is the assistant animal supervisor at the Queens Zoo in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park. He graduated from Fairleigh Dickinson University. His mother, Joyce Hall, of Kennett Square, Pa., is a nursing supervisor there at the Crosslands Continuing Care Community. His father, Ralph E. Hall, of Binghamton, N.Y., is the director of the Broome County Arts Council in Binghamton.
